lines.content: * The main class for the Aura application.
* This class initializes the application and manages the main run loop.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and task list components.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Starts the main run loop of the application.
* It processes user commands until the "bye" command is entered.
error = String.format("ERROR SIR!! The description of the command %s cannot be empty.",
error = "Your input was invalid, make sure to include a valid command";
* The main entry point of the Aura application.
* Handles parsing of user input and date-time strings.
* Initializes a scanner to read from standard input.
* Reads a line of input from the user.
* Parses a date-time string into a LocalDateTime object.
* @param dateTime The date-time string in "yyyy-MM-dd HHmm" format.
* @return The parsed LocalDateTime object, or null if parsing fails.
* This class is responsible for displaying messages to the user and reading user input.
* Initializes the parser for reading user input.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
* Displays the exit message to the user.
* Prints a divider line to the console for better readability.
* Prints a formatted reply to the user.
* @param text The text to be printed.
* Displays an error message when loading from the save file fails.
replyPrint("There seems to have been an error in loading the file");
* Reads and returns the user's input from the console.
* @return The user's input as a String.
* Displays a given list of tasks to the user in a numbered format.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to be displayed.
* Handles loading tasks from and saving tasks to a file.
* Constructs a Storage object with a default file path.
* Constructs a Storage object with a specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the storage file.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs during file reading.

* Parses a date-time string into a LocalDateTime object.
* @param dateTime The date-time string to parse.
* @return The parsed LocalDateTime object, or null if parsing fails.
* Represents a task with a deadline. A `Deadlines` object includes a description and a "by" date-time.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The deadline date and time.
* Constructs a `Deadlines` task with a specific completion status.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param isDone      The completion status of the task.
* @param by          The deadline date and time.
public Deadlines(String description, boolean isDone, LocalDateTime by) {
* Converts a LocalDateTime object to a formatted string for display.
DateTimeFormatter dateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* Converts a LocalDateTime object to a formatted string for saving.
* Returns the string representation of the task for saving to a file.
* @return A formatted string for file storage (e.g., "D|Submit CS2103|1|2025-08-28 1409").
* Returns the string representation of the task for display.
* @return A formatted string for displaying to the user (e.g., [D][X] Submit CS2103 (by Aug 28 2025 2:09 pm).
* Represents an event task. An `Events` object includes a description, a "from" date-time, and a "to" date-time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from        The start date and time of the event.
* @param to          The end date and time of the event.
public Events(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Constructs an `Events` task with a specific completion status.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param isDone      The completion status of the task.
* @param from        The start date and time of the event.
* @param to          The end date and time of the event.
public Events(String description, boolean isDone, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Converts a LocalDateTime object to a formatted string for display.
DateTimeFormatter dateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* Converts a LocalDateTime object to a formatted string for saving.
* Returns the string representation of the task for saving to a file.
* @return A formatted string for file storage (e.g., "E|Submit CS2103|1|2025-08-28 1409|2025-08-28 1420").
* Returns the string representation of the task for display.
* @return A formatted string for displaying to the user
*      (e.g., [E][X] Submit CS2103 (from Aug 28 2025 2:09 pm to Aug 28 2025 2:20 pm).
* Represents a task in the Aura application.
* This is an abstract class that serves as the base for different types of tasks.
* Constructs a task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructs a task with a given description and completion status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param isDone      The completion status of the task.
* Returns the status icon for the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " (a space) otherwise.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task for saving to a file.
* @return A formatted string for file storage.
* Returns a boolean value representing if task description contains specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to be matched
* @return true if the keyword is found, false otherwise.
* Returns a string representation of the task for display.
* @return A formatted string for displaying to the user.
* Manages the list of tasks, including adding, deleting, and modifying tasks.
* Initializes an empty list of tasks and a Ui object for user interaction.
* Loads tasks from a storage file into the task list.
* @param storage The storage handler to load tasks from.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs during file reading.
public void loadTask(Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Saves the current list of tasks to the storage file.
* @param storage The storage handler to save tasks to.
* Prints all tasks in the list to the console.
* Adds a task to the list and displays a confirmation message.
* @param task The task to be added.
* @return true, indicating the operation was successful.
ui.replyPrint("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.replyPrint(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", this.tasks.size()));
* Deletes a task from the list based on user input.
* @param input The user command, including the index of the task to delete.
* @return true if the task was deleted successfully, false otherwise.
ui.replyPrint("Understood Sir, I have removed the task: ");
ui.replyPrint(String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", this.tasks.size()));
ui.replyPrint("You've used the command delete but the index is invalid.");
ui.replyPrint("WHAT? Your input index was not in the list");
* Marks a task as done based on user input.
* @param input The user command, including the index of the task to mark.
* @return true if the task was marked successfully, false otherwise.
ui.replyPrint("Well Done sir! I've marked this task as done: ");
ui.replyPrint("You've used the command mark but the index is invalid.");
ui.replyPrint("If this was intended, please use a different keyword (e.g \"check\")");
System.out.println("WHAT? Your input index was not in the list");
* Marks a task as not done based on user input.
* @param input The user command, including the index of the task to unmark.
* @return true if the task was unmarked successfully, false otherwise.
ui.replyPrint("Alright, I've marked this task as not done: ");
ui.replyPrint("You've used the command unmark but the index is invalid.");
ui.replyPrint("If this was intended, please use a different keyword (e.g \"uncheck\")");
ui.replyPrint("WHAT? Your input index was not in the list");
* Parses user input to create and add a ToDo task.
* @param input The full user command for adding a to-do.
* @return true if the to-do was added successfully, false otherwise.
* Parses user input to create and add a Deadline task.
* @param input The full user command for adding a deadline.
* @return true if the deadline was added successfully, false otherwise.
ui.replyPrint("Please follow the format yyyy-mm-dd HHmm and ensure the date is correct");
* Parses user input to create and add an Event task.
* @param input The full user command for adding an event.
* @return true if the event was added successfully, false otherwise.
ui.replyPrint("Please follow the format yyyy-mm-dd HHmm and ensure the date is correct");
ui.replyPrint("Please follow the format \"event [Task] /from [Start date] /to [End date]\"");
* Filters the task list and returns a new list containing only tasks
* whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* @param input The full user command, including the keyword (e.g., "find book").
* @return A new list of tasks that match the keyword, or null if the input is invalid.
* Represents a to-do task. A `ToDos` object corresponds to a task without any date/time attached.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Constructs a `ToDos` task with a specific completion status.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* @param isDone      The completion status of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the task for saving to a file.
* @return A formatted string for file storage.
* Returns the string representation of the task for display.
* @return A formatted string for displaying to the user.
* Test class for the Deadlines class.
* Tests the toString() method to ensure it formats the deadline details correctly
* for display, including the 12-hour AM/PM time format.
LocalDateTime dateTime = LocalDateTime.of(2025, 8, 27, 18, 0); // 6:00 PM on Aug 27, 2025
Deadlines deadline = new Deadlines("Finish CS2103 IP", dateTime);
String expected = "[D][ ] Finish CS2103 IP (by Aug 27 2025, 6:00 pm)";
* Tests the getSaveLineFormat() method to ensure it formats the deadline details
* correctly for saving to a file, including the 24-hour time format.
Deadlines deadline = new Deadlines("Submit report", dateTime);
* Tests the constructor that accepts a completion status to ensure the
* object is created correctly with the status marked as done.
Deadlines deadline = new Deadlines("Project presentation", true, dateTime);
String expected = "[D][X] Project presentation (by Sep 01 2025, 9:30 am)";
* Test class for the ToDos class.
* Tests the toString() method to ensure it formats the to-do details correctly for display.
ToDos todo = new ToDos("Submit CS2103 IP");
* Tests the getSaveLineFormat() method to ensure it formats the to-do details
* correctly for saving to a file.
* Tests the constructor that accepts a completion status to ensure the
* object is created correctly with the status marked as done.
ToDos todo = new ToDos("Cry about CS2103", true);
